III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules except for
the following:
CPA Rule 400.12212 Personnel records
• (2) The personnel record must contain all the
following information before employment may
occur:
• (f) If the employee has criminal
convictions, the chief administrator or his
or her designee shall complete a written
evaluation of the convictions that
addresses the nature of the conviction,
the length of time since the conviction,
and the relationship of the conviction to
regulated activity.
One of the seven personnel files reviewed did not have documentation that the
Chief Administrator completed a written evaluation of the conviction.
CPA Rule 400.12418 Development of service plans
• (5) An agency shall involve the child's parent or
parents and the foster parents in the
development of service plans to enable the

parent or parents and foster parents to
understand the plan for the child and the
parents' and the foster parent's role in assisting
the agency in carrying out the plan. An agency
shall give a copy to and review the parent-
agency treatment plan with the parent or parents
and foster parents. The agency must inform the
parent or parents and foster parent that the
information in the parent-agency treatment plan
and any other information about the child and
the child's family is confidential.
Four of eleven case records reviewed (2 foster care, 2 independent living) cases
did not indicate that the plan was developed with the parent/parents or foster
parents to enable the parent/parents/foster parents to understand the plan.

VI. Evaluation OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.

There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance:
The agency has submitted one acceptable corrective action plan (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with this individual CAP is as follows:
The CAP submitted was in response to the 2024 interim inspection completed on
8/2/2024 and the CAP was approved on 8/20/2024. The agency was cited for 2
violations. Rule 400.12605 (1) and 722-08D. There were no repeat violations
during this reporting period.
Chief Administrator Assessment:
The Chief Administrator Assessment (CAA) was discussed on site 4/29/2025 with
the Chief Administrator (CA). The (CA) reported it has been a challenge to
maintain compliance with the adoption rules and completing the adoption
evaluation within 90 days. She reported outstanding documentation makes it
difficult especially when dealing with relatives. She said this process is also
difficult when dealing with the courts and Michigan Children’s Institute (MCI)
wanting the agency to give caregivers additional time and not understanding why
the agencies try to deny due to the CPA rules of having the assessment
completed in 90 days. The CA reported that the adoption supervisor resigned
from the agency during this review period; however, one of the adoption staff was
promoted to the supervisor position. She reported that the new supervisor has
plenty of experience and is familiar with the CAP and has been able to support her
staff with remaining in compliance with the CAP.
Financial Overview:
The agency certified independent auditor’s report dated September 30, 2024, and
2023 and the agency annual financial budget was reviewed. There were no
financial concerns identified.
Staff Interviews:
Three staff members were interviewed on site 4/29/2025. The staff members
were all consistent in stating they are supported by their administration,
supervisors and coworkers. The staff members reported they love working for the
agency because the culture and environment is a really good place to work. They
are provided with the training they need to perform their jobs, and all departments
get along with one another. The only change they would make is the mileage rate.
Overall, the staff enjoy what they do and love working with families and keeping
children safe.

Description of Agency Walk Through:
The agency has adequate space and equipment for the staff members to
complete their required responsibilities. Physical CHRI and case files are all stored
securely, preventing unauthorized access. No concerns were noted.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
There were no safety alerts
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the agency will be issued a renewal of their regular license.
